FeedItems.Title: Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "support emphasis" (#9137) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

Support [Extra emphasis](https://github.com/xoofx/markdig/blob/master/src/Markdig.Tests/Specs/EmphasisExtraSpecs.md) (inspired from [Pandoc - Emphasis](http://pandoc.org/README.html#strikeout) and [Markdown-it](https://markdown-it.github.io/))
strike through ~~,
Subscript ~
Superscript ^
Inserted ++
Marked ==

Before change: 
![Before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/172266785-3d6ba395-4088-485a-a309-ca8d2dc1d304.png)


After change: 
![emphasis](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/172266810-480660a9-d489-48ba-947f-359357b52fe3.png)
[ExportedTemplate-Microsoft.Template-20220601160142.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/files/8848917/ExportedTemplate-Microsoft.Template-20220601160142.zip)

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8726

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Merge branch 'main' into dev" (#9131) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[A11y]Incorrect Aria attribute used on label" (#9134) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
URL:'
https://www.nuget.org/users/account/ForgotPassword
https://www.nuget.org/users/account/SignUp

The aria-required property is not allowed on html label elements.
Let's either find the correct property for label elements, or move the aria-required property to the text entry box.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]iFrame is not able to be tab navigated" (#9133) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of an effort to fix tab ordering, we added a "tab-index=-1" property to the reCAPTCHA iframe.
This had the consequence of removing the entire content in the iframe from the tab order.
Changing this to tab-index=1 should enable a sensible tab order AND leave the iframe content in a tabbable state.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Contrast of links on README tables is sometimes not high enough." (#9132) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/171963165-f0f76f41-fed8-4d59-8490-1524165301fd.png)
Colour contrast of the Fancy Zones link is not high enough.
This is due to the table rendering with a non white background colour.

This will likely be an issue on all README pages that have links in tables.
Globally darkening our link colour should address this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Details about Problem When uploading a package to nuget.org manually via the website, I can set a documentation URL that points to a readme file on github, as shown here: https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/  How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge." (#9124) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

[NuGet.org Bug]: Details about Problem When uploading a package to nuget.org manually via the website, I can set a documentation URL that points to a readme file on github,


 as shown here: https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/  

How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge.

### Repro Steps

https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/ 

### Expected Behavior

How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Mark backup folders as private" (#9129) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: They are already set as private in Blob Storage. There is no known scenario that needs public (unauthenticated) access to these blobs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Mark backup folders as private" (#9129) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: They are already set as private in Blob Storage. There is no known scenario that needs public (unauthenticated) access to these blobs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Proposal: Adding dotnet CLI support for projects onboarded to CPM" (#11849) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[Feature]: Add a new interface to provide more context in the Visual Studio authentication prompt" (#11860) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet SDK

### The Elevator Pitch

[IVsCredentialProvider](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/visual-studio-extensibility/nuget-api-in-visual-studio#ivscredentialprovider-interface) doesn't pass any message that can be displayed to the user in the Visual Studio sign in window while authentication to private NuGet feeds. Partner team modified code in their repo to display `NuGet needs your credentials` text in the sign in window but the message doesn't specify which feed NuGet is trying to access. Another downside is that users with multiple accounts may select different account which can cause authentication issues.

NuGet's [ICredentialProvider] interface which is used while interacting with cross-platform authentication plugins, pass a `string message` parameter that provides additional context in CLI environments. This additional context is missing in the current `IVsCredentialProvider` interface. The goal of this feature is to add an `IVs` interface that passes an additional parameter which contains a message that will be added to the sign in prompt. 

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/d21029641e348e06742f5f563edf084ed811ec3a/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Credentials/ICredentialProvider.cs#L12-L24

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Spec for provide context as part of the prompt that asks users to enter their credentials" (#11859) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash] ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab will not show available-to-update packages in the solution-level PM UI when the solution having more than one project" (#11805) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.51

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32509.107
NuGet Version: Dev\6.3.0.51
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2

### Repro steps:
1.Create a solution with two C# Console App (.NET Framework 4.8) projects in VS.
2.Right-Click the solution in the Solution Explorer and select the ‚ÄúMange NuGet Packages for Solution‚Äù.
3.Go to ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab, select a package (e.g. Newtonsoft.Json) and install different versions (with PackageReference format) into the different projects. (e.g. install 12.0.1 into the first project, install 12.0.2 into the second project)
4.Install package ‚ÄúMoq‚Äù (not latest version, e.g. 4.16.1) with PackageReference format into the second project.
5.Observe the ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab and click the ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab.

### Expected:
Correct number (should be 2 in this instance) is showing on the right of ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab and available-to-update packages (‚ÄúNewtonsoft.Json‚Äù and ‚ÄúMoq‚Äù in this instance) should show in the list.

### Actual:
No number is showing on the right of ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab and no available-to-update packages are showing in the list as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/167604752-d49b838c-fbdd-4aeb-8bb9-3f048ce3d14b.png)

### Notes:
1. This issue starts to repro on Dev\6.3.0.10, does not repro on Dev\6.3.0.9.
2. It does not repro when the solution just having one project.
3. It does not repro on .NET SDK style solution.
4. It does not repro when the package is installed with ‚Äúpackages.config‚Äù format in step3.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
